edu.frontrange.csc240.a11.p2

Class Date

  • Object
    • edu.frontrange.csc240.a11.p2.Date

  • public class Date
extends Object
    Project specific holder for dates.
    Version:
    2.1, 2016-08-22, CSC-240 Assignment 6, per the Assignment Instructions
    Author:
    Dr. Bruce K. Haddon, Instructor

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int day
      The day of the month (range is month and year dependent),
      private static int[] DAYS_PER_MONTH
      Days for each month (except February).
      private static int DEFAULT_DAY_VALUE
      Default value for the day if given day not acceptable.
      private static int DEFAULT_MONTH_VALUE
      Default value for the month if given month not acceptable.
      private static int FEB_DAYS_LEAP_YEAR
      February days in a year that is a leap year.
      private static int FEB_DAYS_USUALLY
      February days in a year that is not a leap year.
      private static int FEBRUARY
      The month of February is the second month.
      private static String FORMAT_AMERICAN
      Formatting format for American date format (interpreted as month/day/year).
      private static String FORMAT_ISO8601
      Formatting format for ISO8601 date format (interpreted as year-month-day).
      private boolean ISO8601
      Flag to show date string in ISO8601 format (or not)
      private static int MAJOR_LEAP_CYCLE
      The major cycle of years on which a year is a leap year.
      private static int MINOR_LEAP_CYCLE
      The minor cycle of years on which a year is a leap year (except for the cycle of years that are skipped).
      private static int MINOR_LEAP_SKIP
      The cycle of years where a leap year is skipped out of the minor cycle.
      private int month
      The month of the year (1 to MONTHS_IN_YEAR).
      private static int MONTHS_IN_YEAR
      The number of months in a standard Gregorian year.
      private static java.util.regex.Pattern PATTERN_AMERICAN
      For the factory method, corresponding pattern to match the American format (interpreted as month/day/year).
      private static java.util.regex.Pattern PATTERN_ISO8601
      For the factory method, corresponding pattern to match ISO8601 date format (interpreted as year-month-day).
      private int year
      Year (full year number, including century).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Date(int month, int day, int year)
      The given date is verified, and if unusable day or month numbers are provided, they are replaced by usable values (and error messages are produced).

    • Field Detail

      • DAYS_PER_MONTH

        private static final int[] DAYS_PER_MONTH
        Days for each month (except February).

        Note there is no zeroth month, and the first entry in this array corresponds to the month numbered 1.

      • DEFAULT_DAY_VALUE

        private static final int DEFAULT_DAY_VALUE
        Default value for the day if given day not acceptable.

        private static final int MONTHS_IN_YEAR
        The number of months in a standard Gregorian year.
        See Also:

      • PATTERN_AMERICAN

        private static final java.util.regex.Pattern PATTERN_AMERICAN
        For the factory method, corresponding pattern to match the American format (interpreted as month/day/year).

      • PATTERN_ISO8601

        private static final java.util.regex.Pattern PATTERN_ISO8601
        For the factory method, corresponding pattern to match ISO8601 date format (interpreted as year-month-day).

        private boolean ISO8601
        Flag to show date string in ISO8601 format (or not)

        Year (full year number, including century).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Date

        public Date(int month,
            int day,
            int year)
        The given date is verified, and if unusable day or month numbers are provided, they are replaced by usable values (and error messages are produced).
        Parameters:
        month - the month of the year (1 - MONTHS_IN_YEAR).
        day - the day of the month (range is month and year dependent)
        year - year (full year number, including century).
        See Also:
        checkMonth(int), checkDay(int, int, int)

    • Method Detail

      • setISO8601

        public Date setISO8601(boolean ISO8601)
        Set how toString will show the date.
        Parameters:
        ISO8601 - true if ISO8601 format is desired, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        this Date object

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Show string form in the selected format.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        date of the form m/d/year or year-mm-dd.

      • instance

        public static Date instance(String form)
        Factory method for creating dates from a String form. The form is expected to be either ISO8601 format, or the standard American format. This method is using regular expressions to recognize the form of the given string, a topic that will be taken up in a later lesson.
        Parameters:
        form - the string representing the date
        Returns:
        the corresponding Date object

      • isLeapYear

        public static boolean isLeapYear(int year)
        Determines if a given year is a leap year, if (and only if) the year is the number of a year within the Gregorian calendar (some date after October 15, 1582, or later depending upon the country).
        Parameters:
        year - the given year
        Returns:
        true if a leap year

      • checkDay

        private static int checkDay(int year,
                            int month,
                            int day)
        Utility method to confirm valid day value based on month and year.
        Parameters:
        year - the given year
        month - the given month
        day - the day number to test.
        Returns:
        a usable day number, based on the month and year. An error message is produced if this is not the given number.

      • checkMonth

        private static int checkMonth(int month)
        Utility method to confirm proper month value. Values of month are permitted to be 1 to MONTHS_IN_YEAR inclusive. Month must be checked before day, as the month value is used by the checkDay method.
        Parameters:
        month - a month number to test
        Returns:
        a usable month number. An error message is produced if this is not the given number.
